system.description:
A nondescript, pretty, handsome, or kind and elderly martial artist, serving you tea or alcohol. Little do you know, they are experts in the arts of violence.

(The stats provided here is for a Rank 1 encounter. Check the book for higher ranks.)
system.attacks:
Inflict Violence: Sleeve Flurry. Attack an enemy in 2 tiles with Bravery, then slide 3. Still a melee attack.

Gambits [[/r d8]]

1-2: Rush > Inflict Violence > Walk On Smoke Style [1]: Fly 4 and then gain Evade.

3-4: Rush > Dragon State [1]: Gain +1d on next attack, and increase range by 1, even if melee. > Inflict Violence

5-6: Rush > Reciprocate Style [2]: Attack all enemies adjacent to you with Bravery, then gain Block 1. When the Student loses this Block, they inflict 1 Hit on all adjacent enemies.

7-8: Walk On Smoke Style [1] > Silk Chakra [2]: Attack all fighters in an area (Line 6) with Bravery + Faith, setting aflame.

traits.name: Conviction
traits.description: All Folk have a reason for fighting, and if reasoned to, can cause them to rethink combat. However, they will fight for their Conviction until it looks like all is bleak.

traits.name: Morale
traits.description: At the beginning of any Resound where there are twice as many Kadungganan than there are enemies (eg., If there are 4 Kadungganan and 2 Enemies left) all Folk enemies will Surrender, becoming Defeated.

traits.name: Heirs of the Dragon
traits.description: When a Baikhan fighter starts their riff, they and all adjacent Baikhan are ignited until the end of their next riff. All Ignited Baikhan have +1d to all Attack and Defense dice. Ignited Baikhan cannot be ignited again.

traits.name: Always Ready
traits.description: The student ignores Provoke and Stealth, immune to vantage and flanking. When they ignite, they and all ignited fighters may teleport 1 and confers the other benefits of Always Ready.
